newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australia posts jobless rise despite rate cuts.
newsitem.headline: Australia posts jobless rise despite rate cuts.

text.p: Australia announced an unexpected fall in employment on Thursday, sending the local dollar sharply lower and debt futures higher.
The Australian Bureau of Statistics said the total number of people employed dropped by 40,300 in May, pushing the unemployment rate to 8.8 percent.
Forecasts had centred on a 15,000 employment rise with the unemployment rate staying at 8.7 percent.
Economists said Thursday's data increased the chances for another interest rate cut to jump-start the economy.
"This is just unambiguously scary," said Annette Beacher, senior economist with Citibank Australia. "It is just very, very bad economic news here."
The Australian dollar, already badly hit by the last rate cut on May 23, was quoted at US$0.7509/14 around midday shortly after the jobs data release, down from an earlier US$0.7563/68.

Official Australian interest rates have been cut four times in the past year, partly in an attempt to boost spending and combat high unemployment, which has been stuck above 8.5 percent for the past year.
But consumer confidence has remained sluggish even though home loan rates have dropped to their lowest in 20 years.
